lyrics.stanza: The church is Christ's deep longing And His good pleasure too. His every word and action Is made with her in view. His heart's love is established, And nought can Him deter; Before the earth's foundation His thoughts were filled with her.

The eve of all creation He mused on His delight, And pondered every feature, Well-pleasing in His sight. Creation sprang to being, But deep in Him did hide A heart of depth unfathomed Fixed on a glorious Bride.

And thus His will was 'stablished His counterpart to gain: This blessed, firm intention, Eternally the same. Though sin should e'en beguile man, Then mock his helpless state, He never could forsake her, His yearning ne'er abate.

Then mercy richly flourished, And love was, oh, so vast, As graciously He sought her With wisdom unsurpassed. The love He gave to win her God only comprehends! His life laid down, an offering Whose fragrance yet ascends.

And now in resurrection To her He draws most near, And with untold affection In glory does appear. As she beholds her Bridegroom, His glory floods her heart, 'Til she, His Bride, is raptured, His longed-for counterpart.
